sentences: Anthony Hooper (14 September 1939 â€“ 18 November 2020) was an English singer-songwriter and musician.
He left The Strawbs in 1972 after their album Grave New World, when it became obvious that the band was moving further away from its folk roots towards rock and progressive rock.
He rejoined for a 10-year stint in 1983.
Hooper had been the guitarist in the Ceilidh and barn dance band, Pitchfork, since 1986, and was also a member of Misalliance.
All Our Own Work (with Sandy Denny) (Recorded in 1967 in Denmark but released in 1973)
